title: Bad Bunny is going worldwide this fall. Here's where to find tickets for his sold-out tour.
description: Bad Bunny starts his residency in July. Tickets are sold out, but you can still find resale tickets from StubHub and Vivid Seats.
content: With only a month left of his Puerto Rico residency, Bad Bunny has announced his Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour for 2025 and 2026. The stadium tour will support his most recent album under the same name, which was released earlier this year. The rapper will perform in major cities across Central America, South America, Australia, and Europe, and I’ve rounded up how to get Bad Bunny tickets to see him live below.Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio, aka Bad Bunny, is a Puerto Rican rapper, singer, and songwriter. The Grammy Award-winning "King of Latin Trap" made waves when he was named the most-streamed Spotify artist for three years, from 2020 to 2022. In April 2023, Bad Bunny was the first Latin act to headline the Coachella festival. After taking most of that year off to focus on himself, Bad Bunny went on his wildly successful Most Wanted Tour in 2024.We've got you covered if you're looking for tickets to Bad Bunny's 2025 and 2026 shows. Here's our breakdown of the concert schedule, purchasing details, and resale ticket prices. You can also browse the available tickets for resale on StubHub and Vivid Seats if you're interested.Bad Bunny’s Puerto Rico residency is ongoing with 18 remaining performances, and the final show of the residency is scheduled for September 14. After a short break, the Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour will begin November 11, 2025, in Santo Domingo and will continue around the globe with the final show scheduled in Belgium on July 22, 2026.Original tickets for Bad Bunny’s residency sold out in only four hours after release. Original tickets for the Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour are available on the Colombian Ticket Master website, if they haven’t sold out already.Fortunately, Bad Bunny Tickets are available through verified resale websites like StubHub and Vivid Seats. It should be noted, however, that Vivid Seats does not carry tickets for all countries that Bad Bunny will be performing in.Prices for standard tickets to Bad Bunny's residency and Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour vary significantly depending on date, location, and availability. Overall, prices for the Puerto Rico residency are significantly higher than prices for the rapper’s world stadium tour.On StubHub, the lowest resale prices range from $53 for the March 1, 2026, show in Sydney to $752 for the concert in San Juan on September 13, 2025. Overall, the least expensive StubHub tickets tend to fall between $600 and $700 for the residency this fall and $100 to $200 for the 2025-2026 world tour.Vivid Seats offers similar price ranges for Bad Bunny's performances, starting between $113 on June 3, 2026, in Madrid and $732 for the show in San Juan on September 14, 2025. Overall, the least expensive Vivid Seats tickets tend to fall in the same ranges as StubHub.As is typical of residencies, Bad Bunny had no openers for his Puerto Rico shows. No openers have been announced for the Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour for 2025 and 2026. His 2024 Most Wanted Tour did not feature any openers, so there may not be any this time around, either..All of Bad Bunny's coming performances for both the ongoing residency and his Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour will be international, with the rapper appearing in major cities across Central America, South America, Australia, and Europe. No North American dates have been announced, so many fans hoping to see Bad Bunny live in 2025 or 2026 may have to travel to do so.

The tour will take place in major cities across Central America, South America, Australia, and Europe. Bad Bunny Tickets are available through verified resale websites like StubHub and Vivid Seats. The lowest resale prices range from $53 for the Sydney show to $752 for the San Juan concert on September 13, 2025. No North American dates have been announced for the tour.
shortSummary: Bad Bunny's international tour will begin with his Puerto Rico residency, while his Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour will last 2026.

Chappell Roan is returning to North America this fall for her Visions of Damsels and Other Dangerous Things tour, hot on the heels of her festival lineup across Europe. The viral singer announced the pop-up concerts on her Instagram on July 24, adding that part of the proceeds will go to local organizations supporting trans youth in each venue’s city. She also added two stops to wrap up her festival tour across Europe for August: Edinburgh and Stradbally. If you’re excited to see the “Pink Pony Club” singer live, I’ve broken down how to get Chappell Roan tickets below.
Her first world tour, The Midwest Princess Tour, kicked off in September 2023. With the singer's viral success, the tour was extended through 2024, and the extension included concert dates in major cities across Europe. Following the success of The Midwest Princess Tour, Chappell Roan returned to Europe for the summer of 2025 to perform at several festivals across Europe.
Kayleigh Rose Amstutz, best known as Chappell Roan, is an American singer and songwriter known for her camp and drag queen-inspired visuals. Her first debut EP was dropped in 2017; however, it was her debut studio album, released in 2023, The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess, and her 2025 hit single "Good Luck, Babe!" that put her at the top of the charts.
We've got you covered if you're looking for how to get tickets to Chappell Roan's 2025 appearances. Here's our breakdown of Chappel Roan’s concert schedule, purchasing details, and price comparisons between original and resale tickets. You can also browse ticket and concert details on StubHub and Vivid Seats.
- See also: Is StubHub legit? | Lady Gaga tickets | Katy Perry tickets | Sabrina Carpenter tickets | Kesha tickets | Dua Lipa tickets | Olivia Rodrigo tickets
Chappell Roan 2025 tour schedule
Chappell Roan has 10 remaining appearances scheduled for her festival tour across Europe, with her final show in Europe on August 29 in Stradbally. The Visions of Damsels and Other Dangerous Things tour begins September 10 in New York, with four concerts in New York, two in Kansas City, and two in Pasadena. The final show of the tour is scheduled for a festival appearance on November 14 in Mexico City.

How to buy tickets for Chappell Roan 2025 concert tour
Chappell Roan’s Visions of Damsels and Other Dangerous Things tour is selling tickets through a ticketing platform called Fair AXS instead of standard ticket sales on Ticketmaster. This process was implemented to address the issue of bots and scalpers dominating stocks. You can learn more about the Fair AXS process on the website.
From July 24 to July 27, fans could register to buy tickets on Chappell Roan’s tour page. For registered fans, ticket sales are scheduled to start on August 7. As of writing, no information has been made available about how fans who missed the three-day window can sign up to purchase tickets. Given the high demand to see the hit singer live, we are expecting original tickets to sell out quickly.
As original tickets have not yet been sold to fans, there are no valid tickets available on verified reseller sites. While no policies have been outlined around resold tickets as of writing, given the effort made to avoid tickets being resold by bots and scalpers, resold tickets may not be accepted at these shows.
For the remaining festivals, you can purchase original passes on each festival's respective website. Some festivals are also available on Ticketmaster; however, it’s important to note that not all festivals where Chappell Roan will be performing are available on Ticketmaster.
Tickets for some festivals can also be purchased through verified resale ticket vendors such as StubHub and Vivid Seats. However, it's important to note that, like Ticketmaster, these sites don't sell tickets for all of the music festivals. Tickets for festivals not available on Ticketmaster or verified resale ticket vendors can be found through Chappell Roan’s tour page.
How much are Chappell Roan tickets?
As of this writing, original tickets are not yet available for Chappell Roans' Visions of Damsels and Other Dangerous Things tour. We will provide more information as it becomes available.
Many of Chappell Roan’s upcoming performances are at music festivals with other high-profile headliners, so tickets to Chappell Roan's festival appearances are relatively expensive. The least expensive tickets for both the Leeds and Reading shows start at £125. You may find better luck with availability and pricing through resale ticket platforms.
On StubHub, the cheapest tickets for Chappell Roan's appearances range from $91 for Budapest on August 11 to $138 for Gothenburg on August 9. Vivid Seats prices are higher than StubHub's, with the cheapest tickets ranging from $114 for the August 27 show in Edinburgh to $337 for the festival in Reading on August 22.
Who is opening for Chappell Roan's tour?
Festivals don’t have openers the way traditional concerts do, however, she will be playing alongside other popular artists such as Hozier, Bloc Party, Bring Me the Horizon, and Enter Shikari.
No openers have been announced for the Visions of Damsels and Other Dangerous Things North America tour. Historically, Chappell Roan has made a point of working with local drag artists to open her shows, and she typically announces the openers for shows on Instagram before the concert, so we expect that trend to continue for this tour.
Will there be international tour dates?
Chappell Roan is currently scheduled to perform at 10 festivals across Europe in August and one festival in Mexico City on November 14.

Bruno Mars is returning for another Park MGM Las Vegas residency, and despite the dozens of shows the singer has headlined at the venue, tickets are in high demand. They've largely sold out, leaving only resale options, but there are still plenty of seats available to see the artist live. I've broken down how to get Bruno Mars tickets so you can secure your spot at his summer show.
After rising to fame for his hit single "Just the Way You Are" in 2010, Bruno Mars is still making tracks that are just as popular and performing them on the road 15 years later. Following the release of his chart-topping album "24K Magic," the 15-time Grammy winner began a concert residency at the Park MGM in Las Vegas in 2016, now in its ninth consecutive year.
We've got you covered if you're looking for how to get tickets to Bruno Mars' 2025 Las Vegas residency concert dates. Here's our breakdown of Bruno Mars' 2025 concert schedule, purchasing details, and price comparisons between original and resale tickets. You can also browse ticket specifics on StubHub and Vivid Seats at your leisure.

Bruno Mars 2025 tour schedule
Following another brief hiatus, Bruno Mars' Las Vegas residency returns in August this year, continuing through the first week of September. All shows listed below will take place at the Park MGM in Las Vegas.

How to buy tickets for Bruno Mars' 2025 concert tour
You can buy original tickets for Bruno Mars' 2025 Las Vegas residency on Ticketmaster. As of writing, all concert dates have tickets available; however, original tickets sold out for the 2024 residency, so we expect to see that trend continue in 2025.
Tickets are also available for purchase through resale ticket vendors such as StubHub and Vivid Seats, and they are currently comparable in price to the original tickets. Since the original tickets are expected to sell out, you may find better luck with seating variety and pricing options through these resale sites.
As is typically the case with Las Vegas shows, several VIP packages are available. These packages include a range of different perks, from seats to suites, so if you are looking to plan a trip around your visit, it may be worth reviewing your options. Additional information on what each package includes and the prices can be found here.
How much are Bruno Mars tickets?
Frankly, tickets to see Bruno Mars' Las Vegas residency in 2025 aren't cheap, but prices do vary depending on the date and demand for each show.
The most affordable tickets start at $367 from Vivid Seats and $374 from StubHub as of writing.
Who is opening for Bruno Mars' tour?
Bruno Mars' Las Vegas concert dates will not feature opening acts. This is consistent with his previous residency, so we do not expect any openers to be announced. In the past, Anderson.Paak, Camila Cabello, and Dua Lipa have opened for Mars on tour.
Will there be international tour dates?
There are currently no international tour dates announced as Mars is currently scheduled to perform exclusively in Las Vegas.

System of a Down will be going on tour for the first time since their Wake Up the Souls world tour in 2015, so if you were worried you’d missed your chance to see the band live, now is your opportunity. This fall, their stadium tour will bring them to three cities across North America, with two concerts in each city, and I’ve broken down how to get System of a Down tickets below.
The band featuring Serj Tankian (lead vocals, keyboards), Daron Malakian (guitar, vocals), Shavo Odadjian (bass, backing vocals), and John Dolmayan (drums) will start at Metlife Stadium in New Jersey August 27 and 28 before they travel to Chicago’s Soldier Field for their concerts on August 21 and September 1. The tour will come to a close in Toronto at the Rogers Stadium for the shows on September 3 and 5.
The Armenian-American heavy metal band was formed in Glendale, California, in 1994. Over 7 years between 1998 and 2005, the band released five total albums, and no additional albums have been released since the final two, Mezmerize and Hypnotize. The band went on hiatus a year later before getting back together in 2010. In November 2020, in response to the Second Nagorno-Karabakh War, System of a Down released their first songs in 15 years, "Protect the Land" and "Genocidal Humanoidz".
If you’re looking for how to get tickets to System of the Down’s 2025 stadium tour, then we’ve got you covered. Here’s our breakdown of the band’s 2025 tour schedule, purchasing details, and price comparisons between resale and original tickets. You can also browse concert and ticket specifics at your convenience on StubHub and Vivid Seats.

System of a Down’s 2025 tour schedule
System of a Down will be hitting three cities for two days each for their 2025 stadium tour. The tour starts in New Jersey for the August 26 and 27 shows, moves on to Chicago for August 31 and September 1, before concluding in Toronto for the September 3 and 5 concerts.

How to buy tickets for System of the Down’s 2025 concert tour
You can buy standard original tickets for System of the Down’s 2025 stadium tour dates on Ticketmaster. However, due to the high demand, the number of remaining original tickets is limited.
Tickets to System of the Down’s 2025 tour can also be purchased through verified resale ticket vendors like StubHub and Vivid Seats. For tour dates with a more limited inventory of original tickets, you may find better luck with seating variety and availability on these sites.
How much are tickets?
Ticket prices for System of the Down’s 2025 tour dates vary depending on the date, location, and demand for each show. On Ticketmaster, the cheapest available tickets range from $133 for the opener show in New Jersey on August 27 to $464 for the August 31 show in Chicago.
As of writing, the full price breakdown for the cheapest original tickets on ticket master is as follows:
| Date | City | Ticketmaster prices |
| August 27, 2025 | New Jersey, NJ | $133 |
| August 28, 2025 | New Jersey, NJ | $469 |
| August 31, 2025 | Chicago, IL | $464 |

The lowest-cost tickets to System of the Down’s shows on StubHub range from $68 for the September 3 show in Toronto to $188 for the Chicago show on August 31. Vivid Seats has similar prices, with the least expensive tickets ranging from $83 to $176 for the same dates.
Who is opening for System of a Down’s tour?
System of a Down will co-headline with different bands at each location and have an opener for all of the stadium tour's shows. The band will appear alongside Korn in New Jersey on August 27 and 28, Avenge Sevenfold in Chicago on August 21 and September 1, and finally Deftones in Toronto on September 3 and 5. Progressive rock band Polyphia will be opening for all six shows of the tour.
Will there be international tour dates?
Two of the six shows for the Stadium tour will be in Toronto at the Rogers Stadium on September 3 and 5. No additional international tour dates have been announced at this time.

Dua Lipa's highly anticipated Radical Optimism Tour is well underway, which will take the pop star across the globe through the end of 2025. While tickets are selling fast, there are a few strategies for buying Dua Lipa tickets for her coming concerts.
Radical Optimism marks the "Levitating" singer's third headlining tour, which celebrates the star's 2024 album of the same name. With dozens of shows already on the schedule, The Radical Optimism Tour kicked off on November 5, 2024, in Singapore. During the tour's remaining stops in 2025, Dua Lipa is scheduled to perform in the UK and Ireland, North America, and South America. After a little over a year on the road, Dua Lipa’s Radical Optimism Tour is set to conclude on December 5, 2025, in Mexico City.
While new dates were recently added in Argentina, Chile, Brazil, Peru, Colombia, and Mexico, Dua Lipa has not rescheduled her canceled show in Jakarta, Indonesia, which was originally scheduled for November 9, 2024. So far, the “Houdini” singer has not announced whether the concert will be rescheduled, though she reportedly cited safety concerns for the cancellation.
We’ve got you covered if you’re looking for how to get tickets to Dua Lipa’s 2025 concerts. Bad Bunny is a phenomenon in the world of Latin trap and reggaeton, and now he's about to hit the mainstream. Born Benito Antonio Martinez Ocasio, Bad Bunny hit it big with singles "Soy Peor" and "Tu No Metes Cabra." He's also collaborated with pop songstress Becky G on the song "Mayores." His latest venture is a show on Beats 1 Radio called "Trap Kingz." The year 2018 proved to be a big year for ‘El Conejo Malo,’ from concluding his first-ever tour in the United States with multiple sold-out shows to collaborating with artists and crossing over to mainstream music. Bad Bunny was featured in some of the biggest hits of the year from Cardi B’s “I Like It” alongside J Balvin to “Te Bote” featuring Casper Magico, Nio Garcia, Darell, Nicky Jam, and Ozuna, and "Un Dia" alongside Dua Lipa, J Balvin, and Tainy. In 2018, ‘El Conejo Malo’ announced his 2019 X100PRE tour, which was a smashing success as he sold out iconic arenas around the world. In April 2021, following the pandemic, multi-Latin Grammy-winner Bad Bunny announced his 2022 El Último Tour Del Mundo tour. He followed his arena tour up with a stadium tour announcement for what he called the World's Hottest Tour. Bad Bunny is simply one of the top Latin music stars in the world. Catch Bad Bunny’s chart-topping hit single, “MIA,” live when you attend his next tour.

It's not too late to make your own unforgettable memories at a Coldplay concert. The band's hit Music of the Spheres tour continues through early September, and seats are still available. I've broken down how to buy Coldplay tickets before their next date below.
Following the release of their October 2024 album “Moon Music,” Chris Martin and Coldplay announced that they would stay on the road throughout 2025 to travel across various cities in the United States and Canada. The upcoming shows are part of their ongoing Music of the Spheres Tour, which began in 2022 following the debut of their eponymous 2021 album. The latest extension brings the tour’s total show count to over 200 concerts, during which the band has already accrued more than $1 billion in box office sales.
The 2025 North American leg of Coldplay’s Music of the Spheres Tour includes an additional 17 shows across various cities. These concert dates join Coldplay’s 2025 performances in Asia before the band returns to London. After three years on the road, Coldplay is currently scheduled to bring their Music of the Spheres Tour to a close on September 8, 2025, after a 10-show stint at Wembley Stadium in London.

The opening acts for Coldplay’s other 2025 tour dates in Asia, North America, and Europe will be announced later.
Will there be international tour dates?
In addition to the band’s scheduled dates in North America, Coldplay has 28 international tour dates set in 2025. This includes seven shows across Abu Dhabi and Mumbai that have already passed, three in Hong Kong, six in Seoul, two in Kingston upon Hull, and ten in London.

The name on everyone’s lips in 2025 is Sabrina Carpenter, and her Short N’ Sweet Tour shows no signs of slowing down in terms of demand. The “Manchild” singer originally began her tour in September 2024, with the majority of her shows quickly selling out. With her venues at full capacity, it was no surprise when the second leg, starting in March of 2025, was announced.
With a long list of music and acting credits beginning in 2008, the star gained a huge boost in her notoriety in 2023, when her song “Feather” peaked at No. 1 on the US Pop Songs chart and number 21 on the Billboard Hot 100, and most notably when she was announced as an opening act for numerous stops on Taylor Swift’s record-breaking Eras Tour. This was described as a dream come true by Carpenter, who back in 2009 had posted on Facebook that she tried to enter a Taylor Swift karaoke contest for a chance to meet Swift, but was rejected for being under 13 at the time. Taking the stage on the Eras Tour boosted the “Espresso” singer to new levels of fame, and demand for the 26-year-old singer continues to be at an all-time high.
The Short N’ Sweet tour is scheduled to run through November 23, finishing off with six days at the Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles. Unsurprisingly, the tour has already largely sold out. However, no need to fret if you’re still hoping to catch Sabrina this year and see what the hype is about. We’ve got you covered if you’re looking for how to get tickets for Sabrina Carpenter’s 2025 Short N’ Sweet Tour, as well as her festival appearances. Here's our breakdown of Sabrina Carpenter’s tour schedule, purchasing details, and price comparisons between tickets. You can also look at ticket details at your leisure on StubHub and Vivid Seats.

How to buy tickets for Sabrina Carpenter’s 2025 concert tour
Original standard tickets for Sabrina Carpenter’s 2025 Short N’ Sweet Tour were previously sold on Ticketmaster; however, much like the first leg of her tour, the remaining North American stops have sold out.
Tickets are also available from verified resale vendors such as StubHub and Vivid Seats. Given that there are no longer original tickets available for the Short N’ Sweet Tour, resale tickets are going to be the best option for securing tickets.
How much are Sabrina Carpenter tickets?
Ticket prices for Sabrina Carpenter’s 2025 performances vary depending on the event type (her festival stops or her headlining tour stops), as well as each show’s date, location, and demand. Original standard tickets are no longer available, so resale options will be the most affordable if you’re looking to catch one of her performances.
On StubHub, affordable options range from $204 for Sabrina Carpenter’s Short N’ Sweet Tour stop on November 11 in Toronto, to $404 for her October 24 performance in Pittsburgh. Vivid Seats offers similar pricing for the Short N’ Sweet Tour, with affordable options ranging from $207 for her November 22 stop in Los Angeles to $392 for the October 24 Pittsburgh performance. All prices are before additional taxes and fees are added.
For her festival appearances, ticket prices vary depending on whether it is a single-day or multi-day ticket, with the most affordable options ranging from $288 to $628 between both vendor sites.
Two VIP packages, the Team Sabrina package and the Sweet N’ Satin package, were previously available for purchase. However, like the original standard tickets, these quickly sold out and are no longer available.
Who is opening for Sabrina Carpenter’s tour?
Sabrina Carpenter’s Short N’ Sweet Tour is scheduled to have two openers per show, with Amber Mark set to open for all shows outside Carpenter’s festival appearances at Lollapalooza and Austin City Limits Festival. In addition, Olivia Dean will join Mark as an opening act for the Pittsburgh, New York, and Nashville performances. Ravyn Lenae is said to be scheduled to open for the Short N’ Sweet tour stops in Toronto and Los Angeles. With the tour in such high demand, however, it wouldn’t be unheard of for there to be last-minute changes or special guests joining the star onstage as well.
Will there be international tour dates?
Sabrina Carpenter currently does not have any Short N’ Sweet Tour dates, nor festival performances, scheduled for international locations outside her two dates in Toronto on November 10 and 11. Her tour’s second leg began in Europe when it started this past March, and saw the star travel to the UK, Germany, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Italy, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, and Sweden. Having just finished so many international shows, it is unlikely the star will be back just yet; however, with the demand as high as it is for Sabrina Carpenter, it is not unlikely she may be scheduled for more international shows in the near future.

StubHub is one of the most popular ticket resale sites for online shoppers, making it a household name alongside Ticketmaster and Live Nation. In the age where scams lurk behind every corner, it's scary to trust any site with something like your money or a once-in-a-lifetime event. With that in mind, I dove deeper into StubHub's guarantees and conditions to explain why so many eventgoers, like myself, trust the platform.
For those who haven't used or heard of it before, StubHub is a website marketplace that allows fans of sporting events, musicians, comedians, and other live acts to buy and sell tickets to each other in a regulated space. It services more than just the US, too, offering seats to coveted performances in countries around the world.
Keep reading to learn more about StubHub's protections for both buyers and sellers.
Is StubHub legit?
In short, StubHub is a trustworthy place to buy and sell tickets for major events. Although the company itself is not the seller, it still offers safeguards for both parties in a sale to prevent any potential scams from occurring. It does mean, however, that StubHub does not control the pricing for event tickets — these are set by the users selling them. The site will instead recommend price points for sellers during the listing process.
StubHub gives a 100% guarantee to every order under its exclusive FanProtect Guarantee, which I've broken down below.
How StubHub protects ticket buyers
Ticket buying from a reseller is sometimes the only option for sold-out and high-demand shows. StubHub is a great place to find tickets, especially with its FanProtect Guarantee to cover orders. Here's what it promises for buyers:
- Tickets will be delivered in time for the event.
- The ticket will be valid for the event.
- Issues will be resolved with comparable or better tickets or a refund.
- Event cancellations that aren't rescheduled can be reimbursed with a 120% StubHub credit or a full refund.
For even more information, you can check out StubHub's buyer terms and conditions.
How StubHub protects ticket sellers
Whether you've changed your mind or need to cancel a scheduled event, StubHub is a simple platform for ticket sellers. Listing is quick and easy, and pricing research isn't necessary with the site's recommendations. It also protects its sellers just as well as its buyers under the same FanProtect Guarantee.
StubHub's main promise is on-time payment for tickets sold. The full seller terms and conditions explain this more thoroughly.
What about StubHub fees?
Of course, such protections don't come without a price. StubHub, like every other third-party, charges fees for both fans and sellers. For the latter, you don't pay anything until your tickets sell. Percentages aren't set in stone; they can differ based on ticket prices, event dates, supply, and demand.
Only two costs are added to purchases: a service fee and a fulfillment fee. These can be viewed before, during, and after checkout — here's how:
- Before checkout: Click on the event page filters and change "Price Display Options" to "Include estimated fees."
- During checkout: The entire cost is broken down on the "Review and buy" page, underneath "Your order summary."
- After checkout: Check your order receipt to see the fee breakdown at the bottom.
Head on over to StubHub to browse the latest ticket prices for concerts, live sports, comedy shows, and more.
